comment_10: This song is about a panic attack! Panic attacks are REAL.  This song describes exactly what happens to me when I have a panic attack. If there's one thing people should know about this song, its that it is NOT exaggerating what happens during a panic attack. This is exactly how it feels- In some cases it may be even worse. If you feel like this at times for what seems like no reason... You know that you have what are called "panic attacks" See a doctor or counselor about getting them treated. Panic disorder is the most common "mental disorder" in America.

comment_24: Being someone who has, and continues to, suffer from panic attacks, the lyrics in this song make pefect sense. When you have a panic attack, your entire body is paralyzed, thoughts race, and you feel that death is certain. Listening to this song I can totally relate, panic attacks are one of the scariest things anyone can go through, and, like in the song, "Warning signs never show." Whichever member of DT wrote this probably has experienced a panic attack at some point because physically and mentally, it is incredibly traumatizing and, like Dawgzy said, if you have never experienced one, you have no idea just how incredibly intense and unpredictable they are. Word of advice: Control your stress.
comment_25:
It's about an Anxiety or Panic Disorder. I would know-it's lyrics fit me to a T, being someone who suffers from this 'insane' illness. 

Incase you don't know the full extent of what a panic disorder is, it's when you constantly feel like you're on the edge, you're always tense--and you're interpretations of the things around you constantly spell doom and bad news for you. 
You undergo something called "fight or flight" which he references to. You're pumped with adrenaline when undergoing an attack. As if in a kill or be killed situation. fight for your life, or flee for it. [usually happens when nothing is wrong]

Other symptoms include heart palpations fear of sleep. you become a horrible hypochondriac, and it literally feels impossible to break the cycle. no matter what remedy you try[minus medication, which im personally against]-it follows you like a ball and chain that's fused into your leg.
